recipe_name: Potato cakes with sausage and bacon patties
author: Lesley Waters
method: For the potato cakes, place the grated potato into a bowl lined with a clean tea towel. Squeeze the tea towel to remove the excess liquid from the potatoes. Place the grated potato into a separate bowl with the egg and flour. Season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper and mix. Divide into two patties. Heat the oil in a large frying pan, add the potato cakes and fry for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden-brown all over. Remove from the pan, set aside and keep warm. For the sausage and bacon patties, mix the sausage meat with the chives and black pepper in a bowl. Shape into two patties and wrap each pattie in bacon. Heat the olive oil in the frying pan and fry the patties for 4-5 minutes on each side, or until golden-brown and completely cooked through. To serve, place the potato cakes onto two serving plates and top with the sausage and bacon patties. Serve with ketchup.
ingredients: 1 medium potato, peeled and grated,  1 free-range egg, lightly beaten,  3 tbsp plain flour,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  2 tbsp olive oil,  3 sausages, skins removed,  2 tbsp chopped fresh chives,  freshly ground black pepper ,  2 rashers smoked bacon,  1 tbsp olive oil,  tomato ketchup, to serve
